name: BW362 SAP BW sur SAP HANA 1.0
description: This course enables you to implement and maintain SAP BW powered by SAP HANA. It outlines advantages of the new  SAP "In-Memory" database foundation for SAP BW. It explains HANA specific features as well as optimized data models and functions of SAP BW. Also, the course introduces the new SAP architecture framework of LSA++ and provides guidelines on how to convert your existing EDW-architecture into this new concept. You will also familiarize yourself with native HANA modeling and how both, HANA information views as well as BW InfoProviders, can complement each other in so-called "mixed scenarios". BW362 also covers new data provisioning concepts relevant for release 7.4 based on SAP LT Replication Server and Operational Data Provisioning.

course-announcement: This course prepares a mobile application developer to build simple to large and complex mobile applications using SAP mobile Platform 2.3 and its Native and Hybrid mobile application development paradigms. Participants will first learn concepts associated with the development paradigms such as OData, MBO, and so on then move onto the development of mobile applications using SAP Mobile Platform’;s Native and Hybrid Application development capabilities. Participants learn how to customize platform-specific user interfaces using SAP and third-party SDK APIs. The goal of this course is to teach participants how to develop native and hybrid applications while taking full advantage of the platform. Participants will also learn how to interact with ancillary technologies like third-party IDEs, SDKs, Web Services and RESTful Web Services, as well as other SAP technologies such as SAP NetWeaver Gateway for OData driven applications.
